alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Pulaski; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 10:20PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WHITLEY...CLAY...KNOX...BELL... LAUREL...AND PULASKI COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1020 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from Myrick to Lily to near Holly Bay Rec. Area to near Bent and moving south at 20 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Myrick, Avis, Brush Creek, Artemus, Himyar, Hubbs, Flat Lick, Boone Heights, Old Flat Lick and Baughman around 1025 PM EST. Trosper, Lynn Camp and Fourmile around 1030 PM EST. Kayjay and Knoxfork around 1035 PM EST. Pineville, Ingram, Moore Hill, Wheeler, Wallsend and Straight Creek around 1040 PM EST. Rye, Gray, Bertha Station, Rossland, Clear Creek Springs, Woodbine, Barton and Wasioto around 1045 PM EST. Wilton, Arkle, Davisburg, Garrich, Chenoa, East Pineville and Jarvis around 1050 PM EST. Deering, Youngs Creek, Emmanuel, Lowell, Bentley Station, Ferndale, Baileys Switch and Ponza around 1055 PM EST. Indian Creek, Dishman Springs, Faber and Meldrum around 1100 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Pulaski; Whitley
